title: Simply wonderful service and sourroundings - a true delight!
text:
Although only booked at the last minute and chosen due to its proximity to the Royal Albert Hall, I don't think it's possible to have stumbled across a better hotel in London or perhaps even further afield.
Set in a period property on Kensington High Street, this beautiful hotel lies opposite Kensington Gardens and just a few minutes away from the tube station.
I simply cannot fault the service we received during our one-night stay, with the attention to detail and care on display simply mind-blowing. It seems a little unfair to single out any one member of staff as they were all great, but I think Steven the Doorman probably deserves a mention.
We were very lucky to be upgraded to the Kensington Suite, which is simply wonderful, including a lounge downstairs and mezzanine bedroom/bathroom above. Despite overlooking the gardens and the busy road, I was not disturbed by traffic noise in the slightest (the first time in many stays in London!).
In terms of food we only tried the breakfast - a lovely eggs benedict cooked to order from the menu, plus a wide range of cereals, breads and fruit. The afternoon tea options appeared extensive and something we may try next time we stay.
To summarise this was a beautiful hotel with great staff providing stunning service from start to finish. The high TripAdvisor rating is well deserved and on this evidence should be safe for many years to come.
